paragraphs.text: Jim Murphy's mansion-tax boast is a cynical attempt to buy Scottish votes.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: We have now embarked on the longest general election campaign in the history of Britain
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even political obsessives quail at the thought
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So I plead guilty to bringing a little genuine political debate into the process so early on in the process
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The issue is the new Scottish Labour leader, Jim Murphy, and his vainglorious boast that he is going to use mansion tax money from London and the south-east to pay for 1,000 new nurses in Scotland
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Let me stress that I support the mansion tax in principle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is a redistributive tax
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which is important
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: taxes on assets are always worth considering
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The complication is that it is, in effect, a tax on London, 80% of which will be paid by people in London and the south -east
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the distorted nature of London's housing market could mean a tax with wildly distorted effects
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No one really knows how much it will raise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It seems likely that the people everyone agrees should pay it- the international super-wealthy - will use their expensive lawyers and accountants to evade it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it will hit older Londoners, often public sector workers who bought houses in what were then unfashionable parts of London
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as in my constituency, Hackney North and Stoke Newington
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Now they are living in houses worth ? 1m and rising
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They are often asset rich but cash poor
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Having seen London house prices spiral in value
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they are not reassured by the idea that the mansion tax kicks in only at? 2m
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the very least, a lot of work needs to be put in to reassure those voters, and to fashion a tax that will not hit those people unfairly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Fortunately the shadow chancellor, Ed Balls, has an open mind on the subject
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is why it is surprising that Murphy has jumped in feet first, boasting about how he will spend money from a tax
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there is no agreement on exactly how it will be levied
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am a unionist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I understand that the Labour party has a big electoral challenge in Scotland
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But I cannot believe that Scottish voters will be taken in by a crude attempt to buy their votes with money expropriated from London
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Murphy is really interested in redistributing wealth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: why isn't he talking about council tax revaluation or levels of income tax in Scotland?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead he seeks cheap applause by telling the Scots how he will extract money from England
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Recently there has been a series of reports, including from the London Finance Commission and the Royal Society of Arts City Growth Commission, calling for the devolution of powers to our great cities
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In particular
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: experts are saying that big cities should be allowed to keep their property taxes
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I believe that this process should start with the mansion tax
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Devolution cannot be for Scotland alone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: there should also be devolution of powers to the cities and regions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Murphy cannot bully the rest of the UK about a considered devolution of fiscal powers to all our cities with a pre-emptive strike on the mansion tax
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is too easy to conflate London with bankers and the international glitterati
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But London is more unequal than any other part of Britain
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Child poverty is a third higher in London than the rest of England as a whole
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: So, general election campaign or not, we need a proper debate on devolution of powers to our great cities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is part of the battle against the poverty that still exists in the shadow of the glittering towers of the City of London
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And some people need to be prepared to stand up for London in this important debate
paragraphs.label: assumption
